      • bind

        void bind(InetSocketAddress address)
   throws IOException
        Binds the channel's socket to a local address and configures the socket to listen for connections.

        An invocation of this method is equivalent to the following: 

         bind(local, 0);
        Parameters:
        address - The local address to bind the socket, or null to bind to an automatically assigned socket address
        Throws:
        AlreadyBoundException - if bound
        UnsupportedAddressTypeException - if address unsupported
        ClosedChannelException - if channel is closed
        IOException - if unable to open
        SecurityException - If a security manager has been installed and its checkListen method denies the operation
        Since:
        1.7
